docs.lead_paragraph: A congressional candidate in Alabama is taking aim - literally - at the federal statute known as Obamacare in a new campaign advertisement in which he fires rounds from several weapons into a paper copy of the healthcare reform law.

headline.main: Alabama Candidate Takes Shot, Literally, at Obamacare in Ad
headline.print_headline: Alabama Candidate Takes Shot, Literally, at Obamacare in Ad

docs.snippet: A congressional candidate in Alabama is taking aim - literally - at the federal statute known as Obamacare in a new campaign advertisement in which he fires rounds from several weapons into a paper copy of the healthcare reform law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Back on track after a stumbling start, President Barack Obama's heath care overhaul reached a milestone Thursday, with more than 6 million Americans signed up for coverage through new insurance markets.

headline.main: Obama Says More Than 6M Signed Up for Health Care
headline.print_headline: Obama Says More Than 6M Signed Up for Health Care

docs.snippet: Back on track after a stumbling start, President Barack Obama's heath care overhaul reached a milestone Thursday, with more than 6 million Americans signed up for coverage through new insurance markets.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 6 million people have now signed up for private insurance plans under President Barack Obama's signature healthcare law known as Obamacare, reflecting a surge in enrollments days before the March 31 deadline, the White House said on Thursday.

headline.main: Obamacare Enrollment Tops Six Million as Deadline Looms: White House
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Enrollment Tops Six Million as Deadline Looms: White House

docs.abstract: Don’t tell anyone, but things are looking OK.

docs.lead_paragraph: A few U.S. states whose newly created Obamacare insurance exchanges were stalled by technology failures may join the federal government's HealthCare.gov marketplace for next year, while only two states that relied on the administration plan to go it alone.

headline.main: Faulty State Obamacare Exchanges Weigh Joining HealthCare.gov
headline.print_headline: Faulty State Obamacare Exchanges Weigh Joining HealthCare.gov

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly every day for three months, Carl Bechdel had to make calls or send emails to try to get family insurance coverage for his husband and himself under President Barack Obama's landmark health law.

headline.main: Gay Couples Find Uneven Access to Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: Gay Couples Find Uneven Access to Health Insurance

docs.snippet: Nearly every day for three months, Carl Bechdel had to make calls or send emails to try to get family insurance coverage for his husband and himself under President Barack Obama's landmark health law.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. House of Representatives approved legislation on Thursday to avert looming pay cuts for doctors under the government's Medicare health insurance program for older Americans and the disabled.

headline.main: House Backs One-Year Delay to Doctor Pay Cuts Under Medicare
headline.print_headline: House Backs One-Year Delay to Doctor Pay Cuts Under Medicare

docs.snippet: The U.S. House of Representatives approved legislation on Thursday to avert looming pay cuts for doctors under the government's Medicare health insurance program for older Americans and the disabled.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis and Vatican officials on Thursday told U.S. President Barack Obama they were concerned about "religious freedom" in the United States, an apparent reference to the contraception mandate in Obama's health care plan.

headline.main: Pope Tells Obama of Concern for 'Religious Freedom' in U.S
headline.print_headline: Pope Tells Obama of Concern for 'Religious Freedom' in U.S

docs.snippet: Pope Francis and Vatican officials on Thursday told U.S. President Barack Obama they were concerned about "religious freedom" in the United States, an apparent reference to the contraception mandate in Obama's health care plan.

headline.main: With Banking, What Happens in Europe Does Not Stay in Europe

docs.abstract: The creation of a Single Resolution Mechanism to resolve a failing bank in Europe is an important step forward, but it faces a number of hurdles, writes the principal of MRV Associates.
docs.snippet: The creation of a Single Resolution Mechanism to resolve a failing bank in Europe is an important step forward, but it faces a number of hurdles, writes the principal of MRV Associates.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama heard the Catholic Church's concerns over his health care plan while on a visit to the Vatican on Thursday, but drew a cheerful response from Pope Francis when inviting him to visit Washington.

headline.main: Obama Hears Vatican's Concerns Over Health Care, Invites Pope to US
headline.print_headline: Obama Hears Vatican's Concerns Over Health Care, Invites Pope to US

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama heard the Catholic Church's concerns over his health care plan while on a visit to the Vatican on Thursday, but drew a cheerful response from Pope Francis when inviting him to visit Washington.
